passage_text: An infinity mirror is a pair of mirrors, one fully reflective and the other a one-way mirror, set up so that the one-way mirror reflects an image back onto the fully reflective mirror, in a recursive manner, creating a series of smaller and smaller reflections that appear to recede into an infinite distance. The second reflection travels two centimeters from front mirror to back mirror, and again two centimeters from the back mirror to, and through the front mirror, totaling four centimeters, plus the first reflection (three centimeters) making the second reflection seven centimeters away from the front mirror.
